definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: Was it a dowry of mother's?
However, the fathers of many bridegrooms still require it.
sentences.chinese: 可是，许多新郎的父亲仍然要求女方有陪嫁。

sentences.english: Yi Yin, the prime minister, had been a dowry slave of Tang's wife working in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 伊尹，宰相，曾是汤的妻子陪嫁奴隶，在厨房干活。

sentences.english: A bride's parents often buy a whole set of white goods as a dowry.
sentences.chinese: 新娘的父母通常都买一整套的家用电器作为嫁妆陪嫁。

sentences.chinese: 正好我陪嫁的院子里有一座在慈源寺附近的放生胡同。

definition: dowry/to give as a dowry/to accompany sb
variant of 嫁妝|嫁妆[jia4 zhuang5]
betrothal money (given to the bride's family)
private saved money of close family members
